Package org.concordion.cubano.driver.action

Class ActionWait

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.concordion.cubano.driver.action.ActionWait

  • public class ActionWait
extends java.lang.Object

    Similar to Selenium’s FluentWait implementation but designed for long running tasks such as querying a database until some data appears. Unlike FluentWait it handles exceptions other than RuntimeExceptions. Calling the until() method will retry until either true or a non null value is returned.

    Each ActionWait must defines the maximum amount of time to wait for a condition, as well as the frequency with which to check the condition. Furthermore, the user may configure the wait to ignore specific types of exceptions whilst waiting, warning intervals to log a warning if action is taking longer than expected, a custom message and the ability to override the default behaviour (throwing a TimeOutException) and just return a value.

    Sample usage: 

     // Waiting 2 minutes for data to appear in database, checking for its presence // immediately, then after 10 seconds, and every 5 seconds thereafter. ActionWait wait = new ActionWait()  .withTimeout(TimeUnit.MINUTES, 2)  .withPollingIntervals(TimeUnit.SECONDS, 0, 10, 5)  .withForMessage(“some data to appear”); 
     // Using Java 8 Lambda Expression String value = wait.until(() -> {  ResultSet rs = stmt.executeQuery(query); 
      if (rs.next()) {  return rs.getString(“COLUMN”);  } else {  return null;  } }); 
     // Using new Function - prior to Java 8 String value = wait.until(new IsTrue <String>() {   @Override  public String apply() {  …  } });

    This class makes no thread safety guarantees.

      • withTimeout

        public ActionWait withTimeout(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit,
                              long duration)

        Sets how long to wait for the evaluated condition to be true. Required.

        Parameters:
        unit - The unit of time.
        duration - The timeout duration.
        Returns:
        A self reference.

      • withPollingIntervals

        public ActionWait withPollingIntervals(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit,
                                       java.lang.Integer... intervals)

        Sets the polling intervals. Required.

        Parameters:
        unit - The unit of time.
        intervals - List of polling intervals. To try immediately first value should be zero, if timeout has not expired and then last interval is used repeatedly until reach timeout value or successful result returned.
        Returns:
        A self reference.

      • withWarningIntervals

        public ActionWait withWarningIntervals(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit,
                                       java.lang.Integer... intervals)

        Sets a list of intervals at which to display a warning message if successful response has not been returned.

        Parameters:
        unit - The unit of time.
        intervals - Each interval will be evaluated once the prior interval has passed. An interval is measured from the start of the action so ignores whatever intervals have been used before it.
        Returns:
        A self reference.

        public ActionWait withTimeoutReturningResult()

        By default a timeout exception will be thrown, this will override.

        that behaviour and cause a result to be returned

      • getAttempts

        public int getAttempts()
        Returns:
        The number of attempts taken, starting at 1

      • until

        public <V> V until(ActionWait.IsComplete<V> isTrue)

        Repeatedly applies this instance’s input value to the given function until one of the following occurs:

        1. the function returns either true or a not null value,
        2. the function throws an unignored exception,
        3. the timeout expires,
        4. the current thread is interrupted

        Type Parameters:
        V - The function’s expected return type.
        Parameters:
        isTrue - the parameter to pass to the ActionWait.IsComplete
        Returns:
        The functions’ return value if the function returned something different from null or false before the timeout expired.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - If the timeout expires.

      • pause

        public static void pause(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit,
                         int duration)

        Sleep for the requested time.

        Parameters:
        timeUnit - TimeUnit
        duration - Duration
